summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 29, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in various tiers (G, H, L, M, J, K) throughout the day, following a protocol for observing inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of routine prison logs from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine inmate checks at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York conducted 30-minute checks on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit across multiple tiers (G, H, L, M, J, K) throughout the day, following a mandated observation protocol.

keyFacts: The document is dated July 29, 2019, which is the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
It details the 30-minute check protocol for inmates in the Special Housing Unit, a protocol that would become a central focus in investigations into Epstein's death.
The logs cover multiple tiers (G, H, L, M, J, K) within the SHU, indicating routine operations across the unit.
The document is a standard prison administrative form, showing the institutional procedures in place at the time.
No specific inmate names are listed on these check sheets; they only record staff signatures for completed checks.
